accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, teaching files, artwork and printed material documenting Sylvia Loomis' time teaching in the Arts Education program for the Federal Arts Project.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels NDA 2 (fr.35-47) & NDA 27 (fr. 529-592) available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Photographs of students from classes available on Reel NDA 2; location of originals unknown.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Also in the Archives is material lent for microfilming (reel NDA2) including photographs of students in classes at the FAP Art Education program.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sylvia Loomis was an art teacher in New York, New York.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The papers were initially lent for microfilming in 1964 by Sylvia Loomis. All but the photographs were subsequently donated in 2014 with additional material by Loomis' daughter, Ilse Gay.
